1.text: And Elihu will answer and say,

2.text: Hear, ye wise, my words; and ye knowing, give ear to me.

3.text: For the ear will try words, and the palate will taste of food.

4.text: We will choose to us judgment: we shall know between ourselves what is good.

5.text: For Job said, I was just: and God removed my judgment.

6.text: Shall I speak falsehood against my judgment? mine arrow was desperate without transgression.

7.text: What man as Job he will drink scoffing as water?

8.text: Going for company with those working iniquity, and to go with men of injustice?

9.text: For he said, It will not profit a man in delighting himself with God.

10.text: For this, ye men of heart, hear to me: far be it to God from doing evil; and the Almighty from iniquity.

11.text: For the work of man shall he recompense to him, and a man shall find himself according to his way.

12.text: Also surely God will not do evil, and the Almighty will not pervert judgment.

13.text: Who committed to him the earth? and who set up the habitable globe all of it?

14.text: If he will set his heart to him, he will gather his spirit and his breath to him;

15.text: All flesh shall expire together, and man shall turn back to dust.

16.text: If now understanding, hear this: give ear to the voice of my words.

17.text: Also shall he hating judgment, rule? and if thou wilt condemn the just mighty one?

18.text: Saying to the king, Wickedness; (Belial) to nobles, Injustice.

19.text: Who accepted not the face of chiefs, and looked not upon the rich one before the poor: for his hand made all of them.

20.text: In a moment shall they die, and the middle of the night shall the people be moved and pass away: and the mighty shall be removed with not a hand.

21.text: For his eyes are upon the ways of man, and he will see all his steps.

22.text: Not darkness and not the shadow of death for those working iniquity to hide there.

23.text: For he will not yet set upon man to go to God in judgment.

24.text: He shall break in pieces the mighty, not searching out, and he will set others in their stead.

25.text: For this he will know their work, and he turned the night, and they will be crushed.

26.text: He struck them for the unjust in the place of those seeing;

27.text: Who therefore turned away from after him, and they consider not all his ways,

28.text: To cause the cry of the poor one to come to him, and he will hear the cry of the humble.

29.text: And he will give quiet, and who shall disturb? and he will hide the face, and who shall look upon him? and against a nation and against man wholly:

30.text: From the reigning of the profane man from the people being snared.

31.text: For he said to God, I was lifted up, I will pervert no more.

32.text: Besides I shall see thou wilt teach it to me: if I did iniquity, I will not add.

33.text: Is it with thee? he will requite it, if thou didst refuse, if thou shalt choose, and not I: and what thou knewest, speak.

34.text: Men of heart will say to me, and a wise man heard to me.

35.text: Job will speak not with knowledge, and his word not with understanding.

36.text: My father, Job shall be tried even to the end, for turning back with men of iniquity.

37.text: He will add rebellion to his sin; he will clap between us, and he will multiply his words to God.
